item.title: A resolution designating the week of March 4 through March 8, 2013, as "Military and Veterans Caregiver Week".

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S1274; text as passed Senate: CR S1273)

item.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S1835)
Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S1835)
Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S1732-1733)

summary.text:
Designates the month of April 2014 as Military and Veterans Caregiver Month.

Honors caregivers of members of the Armed Forces and veterans for their service and sacrifice to the United States.

Calls upon the people of the United States to observe such month and to participate in activities that will show support to military families and their sacrifices in service to the United States.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
